comments:
First game of Season 40.

2023 Second Chance competition week 1, semifinal game 1.

Ken Jennings hosts.

clues.clue: In natural form a mixture of 3 isotopes, this element is the most abundant in the Earth's crust & in the human body
Used as a common medical treatment in the 19th century, laudanum is a tincture of this narcotic dissolved in distilled spirits
Sedimentary deposits near Lake Superior produce the largest U.S. annual yield of hematite, the main ore of this metal
Alfred Nobel invented dynamite by mixing kieselguhr, a type of chalky earth, with this liquid explosive
Around 1908, geneticist Thomas Morgan began using this insect to help establish the chromosome theory of heredity
The Gold Coast Railroad Museum boasts the train from which this pres. held a paper telling of his 1948 election "defeat"
Miami has the USA's largest cruise terminal, serving this cruise line named for a nearby sea
Don't look to crash with this Miami Heat legend & wife Gabrielle Union--they sold their mansion for $22 million
The Brickell Section of town has one end of the Tamiami Trail; 264 miles away, the other end is, naturally, in this city
Calle Ocho, or Southwest 8th Street, is the main thoroughfare of this area, home to many exiles
This creature puts the leap in Lepus, its Latin name
That Bubo, this avian, was making noise all night & I couldn't sleep
Instead of its deadly moniker, you can call the creature seen here by this 4-letter Latin name
A horse is this, also a Peter Shaffer play title
Pullus, "chicken", gives us this English word for a young & yummy hen
Types of these include http-only, session & zombie, but none of them go very well with a glass of cold milk
Related to Old Norse "hvina", it's a complaining cry or sound
Not so great with peanut butter on a sandwich, Vaseline has been a brand of this since the 1870s
While playing, Ginger Baker would hold one of these in each hand, but he'd get little nutrition from them
It sounds like you're making pasta when engaging in this activity that involves catching catfish with your bare hands
In 2023 she & Ryan Gosling were the leads for a big-screen live-action "Barbie" adventure
Creators Ruth & Elliot Handler named Barbie & Ken for their children & also co-founded this company that still makes the dolls
In an immersive & interactive experience, you can enter the World of Barbie & visit this iconic home of hers, brought to life
In 2016 Barbie got 3 new & diverse body types in addition to her original: tall, petite & this 5-letter adjective
In 1989 Barbie became an ambassador for this U.N. agency that helps children around the world
This Oscar winner is a descendant of "Mayflower" passenger & Plymouth Colony founder William Bradford
On an episode of "Finding Your Roots", Edward Norton learned that his 12th great-grandparents were John Rolfe & her
In 2004 this distant cousin of "Trees" poet Joyce took to the L.A. stage as Moses in "The Ten Commandments"
Anderson Cooper descends from this shipping & railroad magnate who left a fortune of more than $100 million when he died in 1877

(Jenna Bush Hager presents the clue.) I descend from two U.S. presidents, my father & grandfather, but I'm also related to this 19th century president from New Hampshire though my grandmother, Barbara Bush; just think of her maiden name
Playing center is the Holy C, the Bishop of Rome & the Thunderdome, from Argentina to the arena--this pope turned Trotter
Before coaching the Knicks in "Eddie", this comic & "Ghost" star became an honorary member
This Laker known for his skyhook is an honorary member & was once on a team that actually defeated the Globetrotters
This co-anchor of "Good Morning America" & former guest host of "Jeopardy!" was made an honorary Globetrotter in 2015
Nixon's Secretary of State, he worried about how he would "look in short pants" when he was made an honorary Globetrotter
One of the silent masterworks is 1928's "The Passion of" this 15th century woman
As her, Natalie Portman says, "There won't be another Camelot"
Seen here, this actress played an astronomer in 4th century Alexandria in "Agora"
The Charlton Heston film "55 Days at Peking" is set during this 1900 rebellion
This 2023 film is based on the true story of Joseph Bologne, a Black violinist & composer in 18th century France
At about 9,570 feet, it's Greece's highest & arguably best-known peak
Thessaloniki is the capital city of Central this region, also the name of Philip II's ancient kingdom
Greece's 3 main geographic areas are the islands, the mainland & joined by an isthmus, this peninsula, that lent its name to a war
The setting of plays like "Oedipus" & "Antigone", this Greek city shares its name with a capital city of Ancient Egypt
Corfu is in this sea on Greece's west coast
Influenced by Petrarch, Joachim du Bellay brought this poetic form into French with a collection of 50 of them
The play "Antonius", Mary Sidney's translation of a French work, helped revive this form of "lone speaking" monologue
A romantic epic, him "Innamorato" was followed nearly 30 years later by him "Furioso" in 1516
Poet Henry Vaughan wrote a book of religious devotions bearing the name of this "Mount" near Jerusalem
Margaret of Navarre's 16th century book of stories "The Heptameron" was modeled on a longer work by this Italian
Known for his rock & rolling, this Tupelo man also had dozens of country hits
Mississippi is called this state, after the state tree
Central location--huge! In 1821 Miss. put the capital at LeFleur's Bluff but would rename it this, honoring a future president
Let's get down & dirty! In chocolate desserts, this word comes between Mississippi & either pie or cake
The former home of this civil rights legend, slain in 1963, is now a national monument
Grab some shade in one of these turreted garden houses that as the name suggests is good for a nice view
Eugene Field's poem "The Duel" featured the Calico Cat & this dog
This type of full-rigged sailing ship popular in the 16th & 17th centuries might have one or 2 tiers for guns
The mascot seen here represents these University of South Carolina sports teams
Latin for "sword" gives us the name of this flower

final_jeopardy.clue: The most recent British monarch not to succeed a parent or a sibling was this ruler who succeeded an uncle
